intro: Paraleucothoe keiskei, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Styracaceae and is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its ornamental value comes from its fragrant flowers and attractive foliage, making it a popular choice in gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full shade, thriving in moist, cool environments.
